intro: Tetraplasandra waianensis, commonly known as the Kauaʻi hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Tetraplasandra waianensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Kauaʻi and is found in moist, shaded areas within the forest canopy.
